intro: Cleistes latipetala, commonly known as the broad-petaled cleistocarp, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its unique, closed flowers that open only briefly at night. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with broad, rounded petals. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Cleistes latipetala is a short-lived perennial with a distinctive floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
